<div class="guide-container">
  <div class="guide-header">
    <h1>Local MSP Implementation Guide</h1>
    <p>Step-by-step framework for planning and implementing Marine Spatial Planning at the district/community level in Tanzania</p>
  </div>

  <!-- Table of Contents -->
  <div class="toc-box">
    <h2>üìã Guide Contents</h2>
    <ul class="toc-list">
      <li><a href="#phase1">Phase 1: Planning & Setup (0-3 months)</a></li>
      <li><a href="#phase2">Phase 2: Stakeholder Engagement (3-6 months)</a></li>
      <li><a href="#phase3">Phase 3: Data Collection & Analysis (6-12 months)</a></li>
      <li><a href="#phase4">Phase 4: Spatial Planning & Zoning (12-18 months)</a></li>
      <li><a href="#phase5">Phase 5: Implementation & Enforcement (18+ months)</a></li>
      <li><a href="#phase6">Phase 6: Monitoring & Adaptation (Ongoing)</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>

  <!-- PHASE 1 -->
  <div class="phase-section" id="phase1">
    <h2>
      <span class="phase-number">1</span>
      Planning & Setup Phase
    </h2>
    <div class="phase-timeline">6-12 weeks | Institutional establishment and legal groundwork</div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>1.1 Establish LMSP Steering Committee</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Purpose:</h4>
        <p>Create multi-level governance structure for decision-making and coordination</p>
      </div>
      <div class="key-actors">
        <strong>üèõÔ∏è Key Actors:</strong>
        <p>District Commissioner's office, Local Government leaders, Ministry representatives, community leaders, private sector</p>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Key Activities:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Establish District MSP Steering Committee with 12-15 members</li>
          <li>Define roles, responsibilities, and decision-making protocols</li>
          <li>Schedule regular monthly meetings</li>
          <li>Establish subcommittees (Data, Stakeholder Engagement, Implementation)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="success-criteria">
        <strong>‚úì Success Criteria:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>Committee formally established and recognized by local government</li>
          <li>Terms of reference documented and signed</li>
          <li>First meeting completed with attendance >75%</li>
          <li>Meeting schedule established for next 12 months</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>1.2 Develop LMSP Legal & Policy Framework</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Purpose:</h4>
        <p>Establish legal authority and alignment with national and local policies</p>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Key Activities:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Review existing marine and coastal policies (national and district level)</li>
          <li>Develop LMSP Policy Brief aligned with:</li>
          <ul style="margin-top: 8px;">
            <li>Tanzania Fisheries Act</li>
            <li>Land Act (1999) and Land Use Act (2004)</li>
            <li>Environmental Management Act</li>
            <li>District Development Plans</li>
          </ul>
          <li>Draft LMSP implementation decree or resolution</li>
          <li>Get formal adoption by District Council</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="success-criteria">
        <strong>‚úì Success Criteria:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>Policy document finalized and peer-reviewed</li>
          <li>District Council resolution passed</li>
          <li>Policy gazette published in local media</li>
          <li>All stakeholders aware of legal authority</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>1.3 Secure Funding & Resources</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Potential Funding Sources:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Government:</strong> District budget allocations (fisheries, environment departments)</li>
          <li><strong>Development Partners:</strong> USAID, GEF, World Bank, EU, UNEP</li>
          <li><strong>NGOs:</strong> Conservation organizations (TNC, WWF, IUCN)</li>
          <li><strong>Private Sector:</strong> Fishing associations, tourism businesses</li>
          <li><strong>Blue Economy Revenue:</strong> Fishing license fees, tourism permits</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Estimated Budget Requirements:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Planning & Setup: $15,000-25,000</li>
          <li>Stakeholder Engagement: $20,000-35,000</li>
          <li>Data Collection & Analysis: $30,000-50,000</li>
          <li>Spatial Planning: $25,000-40,000</li>
          <li>Implementation & Enforcement: $40,000-75,000/year</li>
          <li>Monitoring & Evaluation: $15,000-25,000/year</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>1.4 Establish LMSP Secretariat</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Staffing:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>MSP Coordinator:</strong> Overall coordination, government liaison</li>
          <li><strong>Data Manager:</strong> GIS, database systems, monitoring</li>
          <li><strong>Community Engagement Officer:</strong> Stakeholder coordination, consultation</li>
          <li><strong>Administrative Support:</strong> Records, scheduling, reporting</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="resource-box">
        <strong>üì¶ Infrastructure Needs:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>Office space with meeting facilities</li>
          <li>Computers and GIS software (QGIS - free/open source)</li>
          <li>Internet connectivity</li>
          <li>GPS equipment for field surveys</li>
          <li>Database systems for data management</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="risks-challenges">
      <strong>‚ö†Ô∏è Common Challenges & Mitigation:</strong>
      <ul>
        <li><strong>Political instability:</strong> Build support across political lines, document in formal resolutions</li>
        <li><strong>Budget constraints:</strong> Phased approach, leverage existing resources, seek partnerships</li>
        <li><strong>Competing priorities:</strong> Link LMSP to development goals, show economic benefits</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>

  <!-- PHASE 2 -->
  <div class="phase-section" id="phase2">
    <h2>
      <span class="phase-number">2</span>
      Stakeholder Engagement Phase
    </h2>
    <div class="phase-timeline">8-12 weeks | Community consultation and participation planning</div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>2.1 Identify & Map Stakeholders</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Stakeholder Categories:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Government:</strong> District officials, fisheries, environment, lands departments</li>
          <li><strong>Resource Users:</strong> Fishers (artisanal, commercial), aquaculturists, tourism operators</li>
          <li><strong>Communities:</strong> Coastal villages, women groups, youth associations</li>
          <li><strong>Civil Society:</strong> NGOs, environmental organizations, research institutions</li>
          <li><strong>Private Sector:</strong> Fishing companies, hotels, transport operators</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Analysis Framework:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Create stakeholder matrix (interest vs. influence)</li>
          <li>Identify potential conflicts and areas of agreement</li>
          <li>Assess capacity and engagement needs</li>
          <li>Develop tailored engagement strategies</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>2.2 Design Consultation & Engagement Strategy</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Engagement Methods:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Community Forums:</strong> Monthly gatherings in different villages</li>
          <li><strong>Focus Group Discussions:</strong> Separate sessions for fishers, women, youth</li>
          <li><strong>Key Informant Interviews:</strong> With leaders, elders, knowledge holders</li>
          <li><strong>Participatory Mapping:</strong> Communities mark important areas, use zones</li>
          <li><strong>Digital Platforms:</strong> Email updates, WhatsApp groups for broader reach</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="key-actors">
        <strong>üë• Inclusion Priority:</strong>
        <p><strong>Women & Youth:</strong> At least 40% female participation in all forums. Dedicated youth sessions for employment opportunity discussions. Persons with disabilities accommodated in all meetings.</p>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>2.3 Conduct Community Consultation Rounds</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Round 1 - Awareness & Information:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Present LMSP concept and benefits</li>
          <li>Share timeline and process overview</li>
          <li>Listen to community concerns and aspirations</li>
          <li>Collect initial feedback on marine resource issues</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Round 2 - Data & Issues:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Share preliminary data findings</li>
          <li>Discuss marine resource distribution and use conflicts</li>
          <li>Identify priority conservation and livelihood areas</li>
          <li>Collect local ecological knowledge</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Round 3 - Draft Plans & Validation:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Present draft zoning options</li>
          <li>Discuss potential impacts on different groups</li>
          <li>Gather feedback on proposed zones</li>
          <li>Identify support and resistance drivers</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="success-criteria">
      <strong>‚úì Success Criteria:</strong>
      <ul>
        <li>All identified stakeholder groups have participated (minimum 2 sessions each)</li>
        <li>At least 200+ community members engaged in consultations</li>
        <li>Consultation documentation compiled and verified</li>
        <li>Community priorities documented in consultation report</li>
      </ul>
    </div>

    <div class="risks-challenges">
      <strong>‚ö†Ô∏è Common Challenges:</strong>
      <ul>
        <li><strong>Limited participation:</strong> Schedule meetings during off-fishing times, provide meals, transport</li>
        <li><strong>Gender gaps:</strong> Conduct separate women's sessions, provide childcare support</li>
        <li><strong>Conflicting interests:</strong> Use neutral facilitators, acknowledge all perspectives, seek win-win solutions</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>

  <!-- PHASE 3 -->
  <div class="phase-section" id="phase3">
    <h2>
      <span class="phase-number">3</span>
      Data Collection & Analysis Phase
    </h2>
    <div class="phase-timeline">6-12 months | Comprehensive data gathering and spatial analysis</div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>3.1 Establish Data Framework</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Key Data Themes:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Marine Biodiversity:</strong> Fish species, coral reefs, seagrass, mangroves</li>
          <li><strong>Fisheries:</strong> Catch data, fishing grounds, effort, seasonality</li>
          <li><strong>Coastal Infrastructure:</strong> Landing sites, markets, processing facilities</li>
          <li><strong>Communities & Livelihoods:</strong> Population, income sources, employment</li>
          <li><strong>Climate & Oceanography:</strong> Temperature, currents, sea level, upwelling</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="resource-box">
        <strong>üì¶ Data Sources:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>Ministry of Fisheries (catch landings, vessel registries)</li>
          <li>Satellite imagery (free from USGS, ESA)</li>
          <li>Oceanographic databases (GEBCO, Copernicus)</li>
          <li>Community knowledge (participatory mapping)</li>
          <li>Research institutions (TAFIRI, UDSM, NM-AIST)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>3.2 Conduct Field Surveys</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Survey Methods:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Fisheries Surveys:</strong> Interview 100+ fishers on catches, areas, seasonality</li>
          <li><strong>Biological Surveys:</strong> Snorkel/diving surveys of reefs, seagrass, mangroves</li>
          <li><strong>Community Surveys:</strong> Household questionnaires (100-150 households)</li>
          <li><strong>Coastal Mapping:</strong> GPS survey of landing sites, villages, infrastructure</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Data Quality Assurance:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Enumerator training (1-2 weeks)</li>
          <li>Field supervisor oversight</li>
          <li>Data validation and cleaning</li>
          <li>Database integrity checks</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>3.3 GIS Analysis & Mapping</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Spatial Analysis Products:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Base maps (bathymetry, coastline, settlements, infrastructure)</li>
          <li>Fishing ground maps (by species, season, effort)</li>
          <li>Biodiversity hotspot maps (coral reefs, seagrass, mangroves)</li>
          <li>Resource conflict maps (overlapping uses)</li>
          <li>Vulnerability maps (climate exposure, livelihood dependence)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="resource-box">
        <strong>üó∫Ô∏è Tools & Software:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>QGIS (free, open-source GIS software)</li>
          <li>Google Earth Pro (free satellite imagery)</li>
          <li>R/Python (spatial analysis scripting)</li>
          <li>ArcGIS Online (web-based mapping - requires license)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="success-criteria">
      <strong>‚úì Success Criteria:</strong>
      <ul>
        <li>Baseline report completed with all data themes covered</li>
        <li>Minimum 10 thematic maps produced</li>
        <li>Database with 500+ data records established</li>
        <li>Data quality assurance completed</li>
        <li>Community validation of findings conducted</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>

  <!-- PHASE 4 -->
  <div class="phase-section" id="phase4">
    <h2>
      <span class="phase-number">4</span>
      Spatial Planning & Zoning Phase
    </h2>
    <div class="phase-timeline">6-9 months | Development of marine zoning scheme</div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>4.1 Identify Planning Units & Objectives</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Spatial Planning Objectives:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Ecological sustainability - protect biodiversity and ecosystem functions</li>
          <li>Livelihood security - maintain fishing and tourism opportunities</li>
          <li>Economic efficiency - optimize use of marine space</li>
          <li>Social equity - fair benefit distribution, inclusive decision-making</li>
          <li>Climate resilience - enhance ecosystem and community adaptation</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Zoning Framework:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Fisheries Zone:</strong> Sustainable fishing areas with seasonal management</li>
          <li><strong>Conservation Zone:</strong> No-take or strictly managed areas</li>
          <li><strong>Tourism Zone:</strong> Recreation and sustainable tourism areas</li>
          <li><strong>Infrastructure Zone:</strong> Landing sites, ports, shipping lanes</li>
          <li><strong>Multi-use Zone:</strong> Mixed uses with conflict management</li>
          <li><strong>Development Zone:</strong> Area for blue economy expansion</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>4.2 Develop Multiple Zoning Scenarios</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Scenario Development:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li><strong>Scenario A - Conservation-focused:</strong> 25-30% strictly protected areas</li>
          <li><strong>Scenario B - Livelihood-focused:</strong> Maximum fishing access with seasonal closures</li>
          <li><strong>Scenario C - Balanced:</strong> 15-20% protected, sustainable fishing, tourism development</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Impact Assessment for Each Scenario:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Fishing impact (access limitations, catch changes)</li>
          <li>Conservation impact (species protection, ecosystem resilience)</li>
          <li>Livelihood impact (income, employment, food security)</li>
          <li>Gender impact (women fisher access, participation)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>4.3 Stakeholder Validation & Consensus Building</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>Validation Workshops:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Present 3 scenarios to all stakeholder groups</li>
          <li>Discuss pros/cons of each scenario</li>
          <li>Get feedback on preferred option</li>
          <li>Negotiate compromises and modifications</li>
          <li>Seek sign-off from major stakeholder groups</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="key-actors">
        <strong>ü§ù Consensus Building:</strong>
        <p>Work toward "consensus" not "unanimity". Aim for agreement from 80%+ of stakeholders. Document remaining disagreements and rationale for final decision.</p>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="subsection">
      <h3>4.4 Finalize MSP Document</h3>
      <div class="content-box">
        <h4>MSP Document Contents:</h4>
        <ul>
          <li>Executive summary</li>
          <li>Planning context and objectives</li>
          <li>Stakeholder consultation results</li>
          <li>Baseline conditions and issues</li>
          <li>Zoning map and zone descriptions</li>
          <li>Implementation strategy</li>
          <li>Monitoring framework</li>
          <li>Appendices (data, community feedback, technical reports)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="success-criteria">
      <strong>‚úì Success Criteria:</strong>
      <ul>
        <li>Final MSP document approved by Steering Committee</li>
        <li>Zoning map accepted by 80%+ of stakeholder groups</li>
        <li>District Council formal adoption resolution passed</li>
        <li>MSP launched publicly with community ceremony/celebration</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  </div>

          <li><strong>Reporting System:</strong> Mobile app/radio for incident reporting</li>
          <li><strong>Sanctions:</strong> Progressive penalties for violations (warnings, fines, gear confiscation)</li>
        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="resource-box">
        <strong>üì¶ Enforcement Equipment Needs:</strong>
        <ul>
          <li>Patrol boat and fuel</li>
          <li>GPS/communication equipment</li>
          <li>Ranger uniforms and identification</li>
          <li>Storage for confiscated gear</li>

        </ul>
      </div>
      <div class="key-actors">
        <strong>üéì Training Priority:</strong>

    </div>

    <div class="risks-challenges">

      <ul>
